newsitem.title: UK: Exeter Investment Group to float on AIM in Nov.
newsitem.headline: Exeter Investment Group to float on AIM in Nov.

text.p: Exeter Investment Group, the Exeter-based fund manager, said on Monday it planned a flotation on the Alternative Investment Market through a placing of shares next month.

The group has three main subsidiaries: Exeter Asset Management which is investment manager for four London quoted investment trusts and seven unit trusts (mutual funds). It also owns Exeter Fund Managers and Sinclair Henderson, an administration support unit.
The group was founded in 1986, has 388 million under management and had pretax profits of 827,000 stg in the year ended September 30.
The group specialises in niche product investment vehicles and said it hoped to use the new resources to develop and expand its product range and beef up its distribution channels.
Two non-executive directors will be joining the board. They are Michael Cannan and Vivien Gould.
